You're not posting from the account, so I can't actually look it up, but the first game does matter quite a bit. This could have been a zero tolerance ban with supporting evidence given in the form of more than one game. All games are given because they are all supposed to be considered. If the first game never happened (which isn't shown) you would have not been punished without additional negative behavior. So you looking for 'punishable' evidence in games 2 and 3 does not make sense. You were punished directly after game 1, which you are not showing.

Games 2 and 3 are good examples of games containing unsportsmanlike and negative attitude.

These games contain many instances of threatening to report people, which the community has determined is negative behavior.

You also left you ADC to lane solo and went elsewhere as a support in order to spite them.

Telling the enemy to just push mid and end, when the team is not in agreement.

Calling your teammates feeders and claiming they are intentionally feeding.

I'd guess that if I looked at your report history I could find you reporting others for similar behavior and expecting them to be punished for it.

Surely a chat, ranked ban or even a 2week holiday from lol rather than an outright ban would be more appropriate? Granted i dont know if it has already been used but a full out ban for saying report x y or z seems excesive to me considering their is a mute button.

Also its worrying to me is that you are enforcing the meta upon the player base. I regularly abandon an adc who i think will be unable to carry us(no flame or anything just say im roaming) and focus on ganking or aiding lanes which i think can carry, is that ban worthy...

They did not receive ANY punishment for games 2 and 3. Not a chat restriction, not a ban. They received a punishment for the phantom game 1.

The meta is not being forced on players. Claiming in chat that you are abandoning a lane, and then responding to what appears to be multiple people about the decision shows it was not 'breaking the meta' or 'roaming for ganks'. I was simply giving examples. What is and is not acceptable is determined by the community. I was simply pointing out things in the game that I felt constituted unsportsmanlike actions.

OP if you post from your punished account I can give you more specific information about your circumstance. Or you can post game 1, and it may be more evident what happened. Simply trying to help.

I can see where you are coming, but I'm not sure you've fully considered the position Riot is in. Consider this, there are two ways to limit offence/toxicity: Decreasing the trigger or increasing resilience. Riot has no way to increase players resilience. It's simply not possible for them to do so. The only way they are able to reduce toxicity is by limiting the triggering instances. i.e., reducing the language and behaviour that people react to. If Riot want's to create a semi-sportsmanlike game (which they do) that is the target they must attack. The alternative is to leave the status quo and retain a toxic culture for the game.

In the second game, he calls Bard a feeder several times and harassed him the entire game. Again, regardless of Bard's chatlog, he was being just as nasty to him. 
The OP was judged for his responses to these people, and it doesn't matter what they said, because his behavior to them was just as negative and unsportsmanlike. Additionally, the fact that he omits and edits his chat logs doesn't actually give him much credibility as presenting the entire truth. 
Finally, a ban is the final offense after a chat restriction and a 2 week ban. These three games were most likely not the only games that got him banned, since the system files many reported games before acting on the final report. If your behavior is such that it comes to having this much evidence against you, you probably knew and deserved the ban.
